description:
Gave 0.5 opacity to 'Loading Google Docs' spinner

TEST=

messages.text:
Where is the 0.5 opacity?

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10025018/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/file_manager/css/file_manager.css
File chrome/browser/resources/file_manager/css/file_manager.css (left):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10025018/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/file_manager/css/file_manager.css#oldcode1246
chrome/browser/resources/file_manager/css/file_manager.css:1246: background-image: url(../images/spinner.svg);
I don't see the spinner.svg used anywhere now. Bug?

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10025018/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/file_manager/css/file_manager.css
File chrome/browser/resources/file_manager/css/file_manager.css (left):

https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10025018/diff/1/chrome/browser/resources/file_manager/css/file_manager.css#oldcode1246
chrome/browser/resources/file_manager/css/file_manager.css:1246: background-image: url(../images/spinner.svg);
I am reusing .spinner class (see line 546)

> I don't see the spinner.svg used anywhere now. Bug?

subject: Gave 0.5 opacity to 'Loading Google Docs' spinner
